description._content: Title: [Guadalupe College, Seguin, Texas] Creator: Unknown Date: ca. 1900s Place: Seguin, Guadalupe County, Texas Part Of: Lawrence T. Jones III Texas photography collection Description: Guadalupe College (or College of the Guadalupe Baptist Association), was an educational institution for African Americans established in 1884 in Seguin, Texas with the purpose to awaken educational interest among the blacks of Texas and to train teachers and religious leaders. It continued until 1936, when it was destroyed by fire. (Anne Brawner, "Guadalupe College, Handbook of Texas Online). Physical Description: 1 photographic print: gelatin silver; 13.1 x 17.5 cm. on 20.5 x 25 cm. mount File: ag2008_0005_4_4_2_16_guadalupe_opt.jpg Rights: Please cite Southern Methodist University, Central University Libraries, DeGolyer Library when using this image file. A high-quality version of this file may be obtained for a fee by contacting degolyer@smu.edu. For more information, see: digitalcollections.smu.edu/u?/jtx,1160 View the Lawrence T. Jones III Texas Photographs at: digitalcollections.smu.edu/all/cul/jtx/
